Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Quota \Quo"ta\ (kw[=o]"t[.a]), n. [LL., fr. L. quota (sc. pars), fr. quotus which or what in number, of what number, how many, fr. quot how many, akin to quis, qui, who: cf. It. quota a share. See {Who}.] 1. A proportional part or share; the share or proportion assigned to each in a division. ``Quota of troops and money.'' --Motley. [1913 Webster]
2. a share of effort required to be performed, or a share of resources required to be contributed to some common purpose. [PJC]

quota n 1: a prescribed number; "all the salesmen met their quota for the month" 2: a proportional share assigned to each participant 3: a limitation on imports; "the quota for Japanese imports was negotiated"
